description: From the Latin colombina herba (“dove-like plant”), the flower being likened to five clustered pigeons.

entries.meaning: Any plant of the genus Aquilegia, having distinctive bell-shaped flowers with spurs on each petal.

description: From Middle English columbyne, from Old French columbin (French colombin), from Latin columbinus, from columba (“dove, pigeon”).

adjectives.description: columbine (comparative more columbine, superlative most columbine)

entries.meaning: (archaic) Pertaining to a dove or pigeon.
examples: Com forþ now, wiþ þyne eyen columbyn! / How fairer been þy brestes þan is wyn!
